import MethodEndpoint from "@theme/ApiExplorer/MethodEndpoint";
import ParamsDetails from "@theme/ParamsDetails";

import OperationTabs from "@theme/OperationTabs";

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"View file inline"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"get"}
  path={"/api/v1.0/files/{FileId}/inline"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Retrieves the file content with `Content-Disposition: inline` header, enabling direct browser display instead of download. Ideal for images, PDFs, and other browser-viewable content.

**Prerequisites**
1. **FileId** - Obtain from file listings on entities, or from [POST /api/v1.0/files](/docs/api/files/upload-file) upload response.

**Workflow Example**
1. Get file ID from entity attachments (ticket, asset, user profile).
2. Embed URL in `<img>` tag or iframe: `/api/v1.0/files/{FileId}/inline`.
3. Browser displays content directly without download prompt.

**Use Cases**:
- Displaying profile pictures in user interfaces
- Embedding document previews in ticket views
- Showing asset images in inventory screens

**Comparison**:
- This endpoint: `Content-Disposition: inline` for browser display
- [GET /api/v1.0/files/\{FileId\}](/docs/api/files/download-file): `Content-Disposition: attachment` for download

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

<ParamsDetails
  parameters={[{"name":"FileId","in":"path","required":true,"schema":{"type":"string","format":"uuid"}}]}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

<RequestSchema
  title={"Body"}
  body={undefined}
>
  
</RequestSchema>

<StatusCodes
  id={undefined}
  label={undefined}
  responses={{"200":{"description":"File content returned inline","content":{"application/octet-stream":{"schema":{"type":"string","format":"binary"}}}}}}
>
  
</StatusCodes>
